definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To be saturated with liquid by being immersed in it.
examples: I'm going to soak in the bath for a couple of hours.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To immerse in liquid to the point of saturation or thorough permeation.
examples: Soak the beans overnight before cooking.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To penetrate or permeate by saturation.
examples: The water soaked into my shoes and gave me wet feet.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To allow (especially a liquid) to be absorbed; to take in, receive. ( usually + up )
examples: A sponge soaks up water; the skin soaks in moisture.
I soaked up all the knowledge I could at university.

definitions.definition: ( originally US slang , figurative , transitive ) To overcharge or swindle out of a large amount of money.
( slang , dated ) To drink intemperately or gluttonously .
( metallurgy , transitive ) To heat (a metal) before shaping it.
( ceramics , transitive ) To hold a kiln at a particular temperature for a given period of time.
examples: We should soak the kiln at cone 9 for half an hour.

definitions.definition: ( figurative , transitive ) To absorb ; to drain .
( slang , chiefly Mormonism ) To engage in penetrative sex without hip thrusting .

main_definition: ( transitive ) ( slang , boxing ) To hit or strike .
